poem:
A Global Pact

In the brisk morning light,  
the earth takes a breath—  
islands in the throng,  
Pakistan and the Bahamas,  
shuffling forward,  
seeking to quilt the world  
with less smoke,  
to script a new story  
on pages held in the wind,  
a treaty sewn with thread  
of hope and ocean whispers.

The Bahamas is the 15th nation to fully endorse the proposed fossil-fuel non-proliferation treaty, which would provide a binding global roadmap to explicitly halt expansion of coal, oil and gas in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
